**Manifesting Love and Abundance from the** **Dark Night**

_By Rachel McNassor_

__

The dark night of the soul is a profound spiritual experience. If you are
going through this right now, know that there is nothing wrong with you. You
are undergoing a deep alchemical shift that has been encoded in the soul since
the beginning of human consciousness. This article aims to offer context, 1

support, and tips. I will also include my personal story.

Most importantly, I will offer practical guidance about capitalizing on the
dark night in support of manifesting love and abundance.

Most, if not all, of the people you know are going through a kind of dark
night of the soul- but typically, invisibly- under the surface of
distractions, performance, and attachments. The dark night is the great
equalizer.

There is no amount of money or status that can prevent it, as it is an
autonomous energy. The dark night may be suppressed for years, or even an
entire lifetime, and can be in a state of dormancy. This is often the case for
people who more or less ‘fit in’ to conventional society.

When the darkness calls to us, we may

(understandably!) employ countless deferral and avoidance techniques. But at
some point, something mysteriously catalyzes the soul to begin to shed the
skin of persona. The dark night of the soul is an intensive period of burning
through karma and releasing conditioning. It is a profound spiritual
initiation and deserves respect as a holy rite of passage. It is extremely
uncomfortable.

2

If you are in the dark night of the soul, it is common to feel that you may
not make it through. This is not a normal depression. It is a wrenching
dissolution of meaning accompanied by deep grief, as if everything you once
thought was stable is stripped away and you are left bobbing in a violent
ocean of pain and terror. It may sound extreme to speak of it in this way, but
it is important for you to know that this is a normal experience, so I wish to
describe it with accuracy. You may feel that you are dying, or even wish for
it.

Something is dying, but this is a healthy, organic process.

The part of you that is dying is the part that is no longer needed after your
regeneration.

The dark night of the soul can be initiated by a breakup, a health crisis, a
job loss, or can come out of nowhere.

Many people experience a series of dark night experiences, but it is common to
have a ‘big one’ at some point- many times, but not always, at the midlife
point. There may be a sense of sliding into the darkness in a way that is out
of control. It’s true, you don’t have control over the dark night. There are
tools to cope and move through it. But it has an impetus and momentum of its
own. The soul has asserted primacy over the ego at 3

this point. It would probably be more accurate to call it a

‘dark night of the ego.’ Your soul knows what it is doing.

This is good to keep in mind if you experience feelings of torment and
despair. Surrendering to the authority and intelligence of the soul can
mediate feelings of victimization. However, feeling victimized is okay too.

The severity of the dark night of the soul is proportionate to your trauma.
You are entitled to feel frustration and outrage about the level of difficulty
involved. If the idea of karma comforts you, go with that.

But do not worry if you feel you are beyond comfort.

You’re not doing spirituality wrong if you cannot manage to lift yourself to a
higher perspective very well. The only misstep you can make during the dark
night is to pathologize or judge yourself for your experience.

The dark night may arrive after years of spiritual practice, therapy, and
personal development. It will confront any false sense of security you may
have received from adherence to various forms of dogma, protocols, or systems
of thought. There is a ruthless wildness to it. The sacred cows will tumble,
one-by-one.

Dependencies on relationships will be similarly dismantled. There may be a
crumbling of relationships 4

around you, or even severe betrayal. People will not understand what you are
going through unless they have been through it themselves. You may experience
feelings of harsh disappointment as you advance beyond the capacity of most
people to be present for your pain, with the ensuing loneliness. You may feel
like a walking early childhood attachment wound, as you experience emotional
flashbacks to the raw horror of incarnating in a dangerously vulnerable body
amongst people whose unconsciousness is a constant threat to manage. These are
normal sensations.

However, the dark night will also have a surprising protective effect when it
comes to relationships.

Guardians will be activated on your path, like sleeper cells- a reversal of
Agent Smith’s possession of people in _The Matrix_. People can recognize at
some level- perhaps unconsciously- what you are doing when you are walking
this sacred path. You may notice that they ‘make way’

for you. You will receive small kindnesses when you need it. Everyone has
knowledge, deeply buried in our shared human DNA, that your successful journey
through the dark night has importance and impact beyond just your life. You
are traversing the way of the shaman, and you 5

![Image 2](index-6_1.jpg)

will bring medicine back to the collective from your quest. People will
sometimes be mysteriously compelled to nurture your travels. This support may
come from unexpected quarters. You will learn to detach from preferences about
who is there for you and who is not.

This is a superpower because it builds trust between you and the universe.

6

You might like to know how long the dark night of the soul will last. This is
a legitimate concern, as there may be some urgency because of fatigue. This
period will tax your nervous system. You are being physically upgraded, but
you will likely experience it as an exhausting gauntlet. Real rest and
restoration may be elusive, as you are under constant pressure, like a
diamond. In my opinion, this is the part where you do have some agency.

There is a task to the dark night. It is highly individual, but specific work
is needed. Proactive cooperation with the process can expedite your healing.
To accept the assignment of the dark night is to humble yourself to spiritual
concerns. You may not have wanted this for yourself. You may have wanted a
‘normal’ life- the life you were promised by mass consciousness- of
attainment, pleasure, and material gain. But the dark night of the soul is
here to shatter that model. It is like Jesus’s analogy about how you cannot
put new wine in old skins. For you to integrate a higher consciousness, you
will need to sacrifice your vessel- all the old ideas and beliefs, and submit
to a cellular reorganization.

Releasing resistance will ease you out of suffering and usher you into the
gifts of the dark night, which are 7

substantial. Freedom from limitation is at stake. It is worth it.


## **My story**

Reading stories of people who have successfully navigated an extreme dark
night of the soul experience will help you feel less alone. I will tell my
dark night story here. I entered into a devastating dark night of the soul at
the beginning of 2022 when a relationship that was important to me ended
abruptly and painfully. It was as if someone had shoved me off the edge of a
cliff. I was in an emotional free-fall for many months. The total timespan of
my dark night, which could be called the midlife crisis variety, was around
two years, though I was still stabilizing in year three, and I experienced a
few dark night ‘after shocks’- mini dark nights that were more manageable, but
still with the same intense, uncomfortable pressure and fear.

The first three months were agonizing. I had been active with trauma recovery
for over a decade, and had not realized how much this one relationship had
come to symbolize my last hope for redemption for what things 8

had been like for me as a child. He was a mirage of false hope- a buffer. With
him out of the picture, I was engulfed in unbearable panic. Every moment was
an emotional emergency. It was similar to the mental health crises I had
experienced before, but now completely unmediated by any comforting illusions.
It was like waking up in a nightmare. I was in a state of disbelief. I could
not accept this reality. I had not thought it possible to be so cruelly
discarded by someone I thought loved me. I questioned my sanity. Obsessive
thoughts plagued me every second of every day.

Being an action-oriented person, I tried to ‘fix’ the dark night of the soul
with every tool at my disposal. I was particularly preoccupied with clearing
my body. This was not totally misguided, but I underestimated how much of the
relief and transformation would hinge on a personality- rather than physical,
change. I was convinced that I just needed to get off psychiatric medication,
once and for all, and to eliminate all processed foods and caffeine. In my
case, for my particular physiology, these were aligned pursuits, but I went
too fast, titrating rapidly off a high dose of Gabapentin, which I was taking
for anxiety, over the 9

course of only a few weeks. The result was an onslaught of anguish and self-
hatred that had me on my knees, begging god for mercy. Repetitive loving
affirmations helped during that time, but it took months for my brain
chemistry to right itself. (*Always consult with medical professionals when
making choices about medications.) I began to experience frightening
flashbacks, especially during meditation or while partaking in plant medicine.
I ultimately ceased use of psychedelics altogether, as I was worried that I
might not be able to return from the void during one of these journeys, which
typically entailed hours of torment. There were typically no visuals
associated. With or without drug use, flashbacks during this time involved
direct confrontation with what felt like a powerful and toxic parasite that
had grafted onto my consciousness via mine and my family’s generational
trauma, and perhaps even past lifetimes or the collective unconscious. It was
a voice, or more like a feeling, of toxic unworthiness and shame, like being
dipped into a suffocating black sludge. I asserted my desire to live over and
over again, but the only way to get real relief from the strangulation was to
submit repeatedly to change through acknowledging my shadow, feeling and
releasing 10

feelings, and humbling myself to repair my relationships with myself and
others. Just when I thought I had done

‘enough,’ by traveling far outside my comfort zone- such as conceding ground
in a power struggle at work when my ego was activated, or setting boundaries
when I was scared or disempowered, the internal pressure would build again.
The spiritual work during this time was relentless. Passivity was not an
option. It was quite serious and sober.

After about one year of the dark night, I was able to shift my focus slightly
towards the future. But I had a series of false starts and felt that the
universe was keeping me in place. I was still in a highly disagreeable job
situation and experienced a lot of helplessness around money. I was still
struggling with a cannabis addiction. I was resentful towards the person who
had broken my heart and could not let go of an expectation that he would
circle back to me in some fashion. I wanted an apology, or some gesture of
reconciliation. As the months dragged on, it landed on me with a thud that the
unconsciousness of this world cannot be wrangled into submission, which forced
me repeatedly back to focus on myself. I had begun making content on TikTok
regarding spiritual 11

topics. I felt a growing sense of compassion for myself and others who were in
the thick of heavy emotional processing.

At the end of 2022 I got Covid, which left me with a neurological condition
that caused my eyes to shut involuntarily, leading to a fair amount of
functional blindness, as well as spasms around my nose and contractions in my
nasal cavities that inhibited my breathing. I was not positioned financially
to leave my job, and so another lesson began- the lesson of receiving. I had
to rehouse my dog. Often in public I was forced to place my faith in strangers
because of my inability to see. There was no choice but to ask for help,
particularly at work. My team often had to accommodate my disability. I
thought the condition would ultimately resolve, but as of this writing,
several years later, it has not. I was pushed to reevaluate my future, which
led me to begin my spiritual counseling practice- my true purpose, which I can
do while limiting reliance on my vision. In this final segment of the dark
night, my body’s vulnerability led me, finally, into a new chapter. The work
was not complete, but the intensive period of turmoil and suffering had
receded.

12

Three years after the beginning of this experience, I entered into the dark
night once more. When this happened to me it was painful and discouraging, but
it was nowhere near as severe as the first experience, and I had significant
tools, which helped me move as quickly as possible through the initiation. It
again began with the ending of a relationship. I was humbled by the
circumstances, because the patterns that had played out with this relationship
mirrored the first dark night catalyst almost exactly. I was more conscious
this time, and I quickly exited the dynamic when I could see that it was
damaging for me, but that still did not prevent me from descending into a
frightening and sad spiritual exile. The total timeline was three to four
months. The process of decay, integration, and rebuilding was accelerated by
the application of perspectives and tools which I will now discuss!

****

****

13

**Mindset**

Much has been written about how to navigate the dark night of the soul.
Ultimately each individual must follow their own unique path, which somewhat
limits the effectiveness of broad-strokes advice. The key is to come into
alignment with your individual soul’s blueprint. This requires you to accept
your specific incarnation, which is not always so easy! But the work to be
done is the work directly in front of you, meaning that the circumstances of
your own life provide the curriculum. You must practice patience, and trust
that this is not about punishment. It’s actually about manifestation. Your
courage in overcoming fear prepares you to receive the goodness of life.
Seekers are on the fast track, and therefore face heightened existential
dread. That’s normal. You are a front-runner and it is a placement of
privilege and empowerment when channeled in a positive way.

Your greatest enemy during the dark night is resistance.

Resistance is common and you should never judge yourself for it. But it will
fuel and prolong suffering. It may be comforting to think of the resistance as
an aspect of ego, rather than soul. It isn’t coming from the 14

real you. You may experience resistance as heavy existential dread. You may
feel desperate for escape. You may feel you have been backed into a corner and
that you are under extreme spiritual pressure. The gripping fear can become
paralyzing. Resistance can look like passivity and avoidance of life’s
problems.

There is a lot of good news about existential dread.

There is no greater high than overcoming fear. And just like another other
high, it is addictive. When existential dread is haunting you, it’s helpful to
think of yourself as slightly detached from your avatar, or conditioned self.

When you are aligned with your soul, and making choices from that place, you
will always be coaxing the

‘small self,’ or persona along, like a child. Think of yourself as the
puppeteer, wisely propelling the self through the tough conversations, the
humbling concessions, the embodiment of uncomfortable sensations, and the
dissolution of fantasy. When you are not fused with the ego identity,
everything matters less.

Life is an experiment. The stakes are not so high. You may even come to have a
sense of humor about the difficulty of all of this. It is _absurd_. When you
can sit, like 15

an innocent child, with willingness to play the game, and an open heart, the
gifts will start to flow.


## **Support**

The only guidance that will make sense to you is from people who have gone
through the dark night and have emerged intact. Your radar for falsehood will
grow very acute during the dark night of the soul, so don’t become too
discouraged if you feel that the field of viable teachers narrows
considerably. You are not alone.

Mystics since the beginning of time have walked this path. Seekers light the
way for each other through the darkness, even across millennia. However, one
of the features of the dark night for many people can be extreme spiritual
isolation. This is meant to help you center yourself within your own heart.
The loneliness is coming up because it’s coming out. In other words, the
lifetime accrual of feeling separate is being squeezed out of your system, and
you will feel it acutely during the transit.

I want to speak candidly here in providing a side note on extreme despair: I
called suicide hotlines twice during 16

my dark night, and I have zero embarrassment about that. I did not have a plan
to harm myself, but I felt despair at such an extreme level that I was quite
frightened. The people who answer those calls are well-trained to gently guide
you out of scary thought loops, so if you ever get in a real pinch, _please
don’t go through_ _it alone_. There are compassionate people ready to help
(You can text 988 in the US- they’re available twenty-four hours a day, seven
days a week). If nothing else, it can help you get to the next moment, and
that’s the game you are in, moving through each moment, step by careful step.

You haven’t been left behind. The truth is that you have entered a foreign
territory that many do not dare to enter. That’s why you feel alone. It’s not
rejection or abandonment. You’re embarking on the lone, solitary path of the
individual. The failings of codependency and transactional relationships,
hallmarks of this illusory reality, will be stark to you at this time. You may
have a sense of betrayal even by mentors, therapists, or healers whom you had
on a pedestal. This is not because no one can be trusted. This is because you
are being pointed 17

towards refinement of your internal resources. The loneliness of the dark
night is a worthy price to pay for the discovery of your inner authority. To
be sovereign is to lose insecurity and to have faith in yourself. That is pure
gold.


## **The Body**

Your body is your vessel and your lab. In order to transmute the dense
energies of the dark night, you must have clarity in the body. This means
support of the natural systems of the body, and addressing any ways in which
you are being physically harnessed to negative beliefs through your body. For
many that may mean becoming disciplined about foods that contribute to
systemic imbalances and cement harmful programming into your cells and
tissues. This is highly individual and the support of professionals can
certainly play a part.

Seek medical guidance for input about choices that could affect your mental
and emotional equilibrium, as this is a delicate time, and stability is
crucial.

Clearing of the body will entail emotional purges and these can be quite
difficult. It helps to know that this is a 18

natural and organic process. The key is to keep that energy moving so that it
doesn’t stagnate and create self-destructive thought loops. There are many
ways to do somatic work. A slow-moving practice like yoga or tai chi can
surface the stuck energy and move it out of your system. You may not feel like
exercise at all. Or conversely, you may be the type that self-punishes through
over-exertion. Consistency, rather than force, may make the biggest difference
of all. Embodiment is where spirituality matures. It is no longer about the
correct beliefs, guru worship, or wishful thinking, Embodiment is what is
real, right here and now. It is rigorous honesty about what is presenting in
your container, and devotion to metabolizing it. It is not true that time
alone heals all wounds. You will feel better as you confront the discomfort
and fear proactively. I wish I could tell you about a shortcut! I would have
discovered it by now if it existed because I was extremely traumatized,
addicted, and avoidant entering into this experience.

****

****

19

**Manifestation**

You’re having this experience so that you can clear a pathway for your
manifestation to come forth. Teachings about manifestation commonly
underemphasize the role of shadow work. The extremity of the dark night shows
you how much creative potential you have. All that dense energy is your fuel
for a life of abundance, joy, and love. The shadow holds the keys. The shadow
is not negative; it’s simply the parts of ourselves that we push into our
blind spot because we were shamed about them. Ritual is a form of embodiment
practice that involves symbolic gesture, which puts you in the driver’s seat.
You become the magician from the tarot, wielding spiritual power into this
physical reality. When you practice ritual, you convert shadow material into
your good. But that material needs full expression, which is what your ritual
accomplishes. When you embody shadow elements, you act out a ceremonial play,
so that the shadow has an audience, and is witnessed. You can think of it as
being temporarily possessed- but not in a scary, science fiction way. The
energy only wants your attention, and then it will be satisfied and release
its hold on you.

20

I will give a personal example from my dark night of the soul about how shadow
work makes an actual difference. At the time one of my bosses was very
aggressive with me. She mimicked one of my childhood abusers. They even looked
the same! I felt I was in a nightmare. Every time we had a meeting, she would
predictably lie to me, pressure me, and criticize me. I tried to avoid her,
fight back, appease her, and overperform in my job. None of these tactics
worked. I felt the same victimization and helplessness that I did as a child.
The dark night of the soul was doing its job, because what was needed was
addressing the underlying energy. I had resistance about this, because the
truth is that I had a lot of rage about the childhood abuse. I thought I had
already done the work, and was frustrated that it had not solved this lifelong
pattern of being targeted and scapegoated. A useful thing to understand is
that when you are climaxing a pattern, right before the breakthrough point,
you may endure a reenactment that is cartoonishly terrible. This is meant to
help you break down denial, the natural defense of the abused or neglected
child. In other words, what feels like a regression is actually moving you
forward, by surfacing what was once minimized. A severe 21

reenactment after you have already been doing the work can be a positive sign
that you are at the breakthrough moment, scraping the bottom of the barrel, so
that you never have to repeat it.

The tension was unbearable, and there didn’t seem to be any escape. I applied
for other jobs, and was turned down even when I was over-qualified. The
universe was intent that I do this _now._ So, I got busy with anger work. I
began to practice it every day. (instructions on practicing anger rituals to
follow, pages 28-33). I began to develop subtle ways to manage the
relationship with my boss.

One day I was deep in the pit of the dark night when I suddenly received
creative, inspired thought about how I needed to invite her to an event. I
realized that if I was not holding onto the fight with her, that was
_actually_ the way to win. I humbled myself and extended myself to her, and
her reaction was so positive that it felt like an incredible superpower. I
literally jumped out of my bed, full of new energy. This happened because I
was directing my anger towards the origin point. Once I removed the projection
from my boss, it changed the dynamic and we were able to have a more peaceful
relationship. She likely felt less pressure to exert control 22

over me, because she was no longer having to carry the invisible projection of
my unclaimed anger about a past that had nothing to do with her. The
competition for power was over. I began to have more room to maneuver at work,
and create. That’s the conversion of anger into manifestation.

23

![Image 3](index-24_1.jpg)


## **Anger**

Anger is a powerful manifestation tool, and it is a step that cannot be
skipped. Anger is largely overlooked in conventional forms of therapy, as well
as in most expressions of spirituality. Anger is evidence of your love for
yourself. When you were a child, you experienced outrage about mistreatment
because you knew that it was wrong. However, if your anger was suppressed,
shamed, or punished by your family, it would have 24

become locked away in the shadow. When anger is unconscious it determines your
reality. It does not matter how ‘nice’ you are, suppressed anger will attract
victimization in one form another.

Anger work is how you get yourself out of the scapegoat role so that you can
create your reality. The reason anger feels uncomfortable or taboo is that it
is a powerful resource, and is therefore hoarded. If one person in your family
was allowed to feel anger, that is the person who was allowed to exert
control. This dynamic is replicated in institutions and jobs. Toxic leaders
know how to wield anger over subordinates who are essentially still slaves to
their unprocessed childhood trauma. It is easy to manipulate someone who has
unconscious anger, because anger that is unconscious is unclaimed, and gets
projected outward and animates abusers, who will gladly take on that
profitable power for their own benefit. If you have suppressed anger, abusers
can hook into your hidden rage, like a battery. They will drain you. But they
are useful to you. They are performing the _original_ trauma for you. This
pantomime chips away at your denial (and potential trauma amnesia), so that
you can excavate and purge feelings from the past.

25

When you learn how to metabolize anger, you reverse the pattern of your energy
being extracted by others.

You increase your magnetism. The world will begin to come towards you. People
do not know quite what has changed, and would not be able to describe it, but
there is just something about you- they want to protect you and give to you.
Doing anger work creates a strong energetic boundary around you. You will no
longer need to have exhausting conversations convincing others about your
boundaries. Your energy will be out in front of you, doing the work on your
behalf. You gain a layer of spiritual protection through practicing anger
work. You become powerful.

Anger work is the most potent form of inner child work.

It sends a message to the inner child that you love them so much, you are
willing to be furious on their behalf about what things were like for them.
Your inner child finally feels their suffering is taken seriously. Because we
live in a quantum soup, when you do anger work, your inner child experiences
it on their timeline as an adult finally showing up and saying, “Something is
wrong. This treatment is not ok. Things must change.” You become your own
knight in shining armor. Therefore, the inner 26

child relaxes and you will experience a deactivation in your nervous system.
In this way, an effective way to reduce anxiety and increase a sense of safety
in the body is through doing anger work.

The way anger typically works in our society is that it bubbles under the
surface, unacknowledged, until it is triggered, then erupts reactively. Doing
anger work proactively creates a container for it. I suggest doing anger work
in ritual format. This enlists spiritual support, because the universe likes
to see intention and effort, which is what ceremony accomplishes. Think of
anger ritual as a kind of portal into your childhood frustration, which will
be pulled into the present (through the body), and cooked in your lab into
your beautiful manifestations. Effective shadow work is not an intellectual
exercise. It involves feeling the emotion in your body. This is not
comfortable, but it is wise to be proactive, rather than suppress it.
Directing anger towards the childhood influences, such as through anger
letters (that you will burn or tear up, not send) peels the reenactment off
any present-day antagonists. You can do this in the privacy of your home. It’s
a shortcut that influences people more directly (and subtlety) than 27

trying to wrangle them through direct communication into changing their
behavior.


## **Ritual**

I will now describe an anger ritual that you can perform frequently to start
working trauma energy out of your body during the dark night of the soul. You
might even like to do it daily! The total duration will be between 15

and 30 minutes. Repetition will yield the best results. For the purpose of the
ritual, we will assume that you are being triggered by someone. This could be
an ex who abandoned you, or an authority figure who is pushing you around, or
anyone who is reenacting your childhood trauma in any way. However, the bulk
of the exercise will be anger work targeting the point in the past when your
relational template was installed (usually by caregivers in childhood).

The foundational step is to create a container for your ritual. This can be as
simple as burning sage before and after the ritual. You can get as intricate
as you want, such as taking a ritual bath before and after to clear your
energy, or wearing special clothing. Our ancestors 28

performed ceremony to commune with the spirit world.

It is literally tragic that this has become a peripheral art, but that just
means you have an edge when you partake.

When you make effort and put thought into meaningful symbols, spirit world
supports you in your quest.

However, don’t make your ritual so detailed that you are disincentivized to do
it, because repetition is primary.

1\. Intention: The first step in the sequence is to voice an intention. When
you say it, be sincere and use your emotion. Your emotions are the ingredients
in this cake you are baking. A basic intention you can modify is “I am now
willing to feel and release anger from my childhood trauma, so that it is no
longer being reenacted unconsciously in my life.”

2\. Embodiment: The second step is a physical expression of anger. This could
be dancing or shaking. You can listen to loud music if that helps. You want to
feel the anger in your body. Feeling it transports it out of your energy, and
raises your vibration so that you are no longer magnetizing victimization and
disempowerment. You can make faces, do lion’s breathe, or scream into a
pillow. I went through a period of time in which the only satisfying anger
work was destructive. I was concerned 29

about safety because I kept throwing furniture around.

After much trial and error, I developed a satisfying method. I took Amazon
cardboard boxes and packed them inside each other, like nesting dolls. I
wrapped this up with tape, then hit it with a baseball bat. For your ritual,
the physical part doesn’t have to go on for too long- maybe just a few
minutes. Don’t be a perfectionist about it. This can feel taboo. If at first
you can only shuffle around in a circle a bit, that still counts. The channel
will open with practice.

3\. Anger letters: The third step is to write anger letters to the “original
offenders.” For most people, this is their parents. No one will ever see these
letters, so you can go crazy with it. You want to go fully into blame. This is
not the time for forgiveness or empathy. This is your inner child’s day in
court. This is when you get to be squarely on your side. Be detailed and let
them know how wrong it was. Use phrases like, “How dare you,” and “I’m furious
about it,” and “It was immoral.” Notice we are not aiming this at the current-
day antagonist- the ex who abandoned you, or the authority figure who is
pushing you around. Those figures are simply the Civil war reenactors. They
look convincing, but there are no 30

bullets in their guns. Your anger letters put you into integrity about the
actual harm that created your relational template long ago. You are correctly
identifying the perpetrator from the witness box, so to speak. When you finish
the anger letters you can burn them or tear them up. That releases them into
the ether.

This piece of the ritual helps externalize the anger and get it out of your
body, and deposits it on the page.

A note on forgiveness- forgiveness does have relevance but it is best to think
of it as a neutralization of energy, rather than as something that you are
giving, or that you owe people. Doing anger work produces forgiveness
automatically, because it heals the harm, and that makes it easier to let go
of grudges. When you practice your anger work regularly, your family members
are none the wiser. This is not hexing. It’s taking responsibility for how the
trauma lodged in your system. There is deep integrity in that.

A note on guilt- guilt is often something new coming into consciousness. When
you think about this, it makes sense. When you are growing outside of your
comfort zone, you must be disloyal to your conditioning, so you may experience
a sensation of culpability. It comes with 31

the territory. Guilt doesn’t necessarily mean you have done something wrong.
It may just mean that you are expanding. When you come from a toxic family,
you could say that you can’t grow without some amount of guilt.

4\. Firing the reenactor: The last piece of the ritual is where we address the
current-day antagonist. This is where we finally manifest and influence the
present. It will work now, because you have cleared the energy from the past
and now you have a blank canvas. This part is a letter as well- that you will
also burn or tear up.

Write a letter to the antagonist (the ex, authority figure, etc.), and fire
them from reenacting your childhood trauma. You can write this in formal HR
language: “Dear X, effective immediately, you are hereby terminated from
reenacting the childhood

abuse/neglect/abandonment (feel free to be specific about what they are
portraying). You did a great job. A-plus performance! You put the trauma in my
face, and I needed that so I could alchemize it. However, I’m going to do that
work directly with the original offenders now, so there’s no need for you to
do that any more. You’re fired.” Keep your energy neutral, or even playful.

32

You will be surprised about how well this works. The current-day antagonist
will perceive, at some level, that the projection of your unhealed trauma
wounds is no longer on their shoulders (energetically). They may soften
towards you or act differently. But even if they do not, you won’t be as
bothered anymore because the trigger has been removed. This gives you power so
that trauma bonds and reenactments are not directing your life.

If you can read, absorb, and put into regular practice this sequence, you are
miles ahead of where most people get in their lifetimes. If I had to point to
one thing that keeps people stuck in harmful patterns more than anything else,
it is reluctance to take responsibility for anger by embodying it, as
described here. It is understandable because anger is deeply taboo for many of
us. But what starts as an annoying piece of spiritual homework becomes the
delicious secret to creating in your life. Practicing anger work can also help
to reconcile you to having experienced trauma, because it finally gains a
utility for you. Give it a try so that you can see the results!

## **Heartbreak**

The loss of a romantic relationship, or lack of fulfillment within an existing
romantic relationship, can be excruciating, and it can be a common aspect or
catalyst of the dark night of the soul. Abandonment wounds, deeply buried, can
surface at this time with brutal force.

It’s normal to feel despair and disillusionment when this happens. You may
also experience frantic obsessive thoughts, as the psyche scrambles for some
kind of internal paradigm of safety or reconciliation of cognitive 34

dissonance. What has happened is that your soul has orchestrated, through
heartbreak, a dismantling of attachment-oriented love, and it feels like a
death.

Attachment-oriented love is a relationship structure that rests on a rigid
template, installed by your family, based on rules, conditions, and
psychologically-contractual obligations to uphold narratives. I will give some
examples of this.

You may have learned that love must be earned. This is common in dysfunctional
families. If someone rejects you romantically, it feels as if you have failed
a test of worthiness. But the person has not rejected you**\- the** **timeline
in which you believe that you must prove your** **worth has rejected you** ,
because you are no longer a vibrational match for it. Typically, this happens
because you have moved further into heart coherence and authentic
vulnerability, which puts strain on a connection built on unconscious
programs. Your loved one ejects you from the silent agreement that the two of
you had at one time, whereby your efforts to be good enough bolstered their
fragility, while also validating the sense of accomplishment you got from
winning approval that was withheld. This process of expulsion has 35

originated from within your spiritual blueprint. If your partner is working
with more fear than you, they will be the one to initiate withdrawal from the
connection, but it is your expansion that has set it in motion energetically.
The ensuing heartbreak is the death throes of the belief system that may have
provided a false sense of security in relationships going back to the very
beginning of your life. That’s why there is so much torment and fear with
heartbreak. It brings you into contact with the threat of annihilation. As an
infant, if you were not able to secure the love of a parent, it was so
dangerous for you, in your dependent state.

However, the idea that you could create safety for yourself by being good
enough was a false delusion. It was never true. It was a comforting fantasy
that cushioned you against the actual reality of your vulnerability. You
needed it at the time, because small children cannot bear to face the actual
truth of the unconsciousness of their parents. When someone breaks your heart,
the accumulated grief and betrayal from a lifetime of saturation in
unconsciousness bursts forth like a dam breaking. They have actually done you
a big favor, because this is a detox from contamination 36

that will leave you clearer. Then you have a shot at real love, the kind that
is reciprocal and not based on battles for control. Because much as it is easy
to blame the one whose courage collapses first, you have also been in a
struggle for power through relationships- commonly to settle the score for a
past harm wherein you were victimized. Your belief is that if you can get this
person to love you, it rewrites the ending of wounding located in the past.
But you must have compassion for yourself. You are only seeking healing. It’s
just that you have gone to the dry cleaners instead of the pharmacy to pick up
the medicine. It’s understandable, because the _real_ medicine will feel like
poison at first, and you may want to avoid it.

You must feel the buried feelings from early life. Many people seek
relationships to avoid exactly that.

I want to note a few things about the twin flame content prevalent in the
spiritual community. Much of that content does have useful information about
healing, depending on the teacher- such as an emphasis on shadow work. But it
can also feed obsessiveness, such as through the untrue claim that you share a
soul with another person. You are a full soul. You are complete as you are and
you are not in mandatory spiritual bondage 37

with anyone. In my opinion, it’s fine to consume twin flame content if it
feels comforting for a period when you are coping with the shock of the dark
night of the soul and are in extreme pain. This process is about coming into
the truth as revealed organically within you, so allow yourself the space to
sort out what is real to you, using your own experience. In the classic
Cinderella story- not the Disney version, but the ancient fairytale told in
many different iterations, across hundreds of years, several versions depict
Cinderella at one point delicately sifting lentils from ash. This is a good
metaphor for the process of discernment. Your experience matters, and you get
to carefully assign meaning. Just be aware that orthodoxy is as alive within
the New Age spiritual community as it is in fundamentalist religion. In the
scramble for answers, you could adopt a replacement belief system that is just
as much of a program. But if that is the case, it’s ok. It’s part of the
process. I went down the twin flame rabbit hole for a time and I’m not
embarrassed about that.

What is most exciting to consider is the _ultimate_ prize on offer when you
experience heartbreak, which is a crack at inner union. This is the Beloved of
whom Rumi spoke-38

your internal lover. Now it can be challenging to be motivated by this when it
feels like a vague apparition-whereas your ex feels like a tangible, physical,
portal into love that is now being cruelly withheld from you. It’s okay if
inner union sounds like a second-rate door prize that does nothing to stem the
bleeding. It is not a path chosen by the majority, because it requires
devotion and faith of the highest order. But it’s worth it. And it is a
prerequisite for reciprocal love with another. It is through grieving the loss
of your person that you will discover this hidden pearl within the oyster. It
will come in glimpses at first, perhaps as a softening into sweetness and
self-compassion after you have cried wretched tears for hours. In other words,
feeling your feelings is key. However, there is a little more to it, and I
would like to speak of the ‘work’ of coming into inner union, because
proactive empowerment provides much relief from heartbreak.

Carl Jung spoke of the anima and animus. For a woman, or primarily feminine-
identifying person, she will have an animus, which is an internal masculine
counterpart. For a man, or primarily masculine-identifying person, he will
have an anima, which is an internal feminine 39

counterpart. The process of individuation is to develop that contra-sexual
part. Carl Jung framed this in contemporary psychological language, but this
goes back for millennia, especially in the East. You can think of the yin/yang
symbol, or statues of the Buddha looking very feminine, for instance. It’s
almost as if the process of spiritual growth brings you into a type of
energetic androgyny, with both energies being fully expressed in your
consciousness. But because we live in a binary reality with conscripted gender
identification norms, our

‘opposite’ tends to be relegated to the shadow. This is how you get, for
instance, women who are disempowered around financial independence, or men who
are not in touch with their feelings.

A broken relationship is an invitation to become more balanced in your divine
feminine and masculine energy. I want to describe methods to do this. The
first method is through working with your dreams. Your counterpart will show
up in your dreams, as either masculine characters (animus), or feminine
characters (anima). Watch what these characters do for clues about your
relationship with that energy. The animus or anima is the “Other” in the
psyche. They hold the key to your manifestation, 40

because masculine and feminine energies are the building blocks of creation.
Because dreams are so concerned with illuminating your shadow, they will
deliver key insights. For instance, if you are a man, (or if you are strongest
or most dominant in your masculine energy), and you had a mother who was
engulfing or controlling, you might have dreams about feminine figures who are
punishing or harsh, letting you know that anger work is needed about your
mother. As you do your anger work, feminine figures in dreams may become
softer, and more aligned with you. They may begin to show you attributes you
have that are gifts, but have been “held” by the feminine in the shadow, such
as intuition. This is how your shadow work and dream work start to work hand-
in-hand.

Dream recall is essential for spiritual development.

Dreams don’t come from the ego, they are soul transmissions that offer you the
codes to your personalized instruction manual for life. If you have trouble
remembering dreams, there is a clever technique. Before you go to bed each
night, write down in a notebook that you keep by your bed, “Please send me a
psychic dream that I remember in the morning.”

41

Write it down several times. When you wake up in the morning, write down
whatever you remember, even if it is a fragment or a feeling. If you don’t
remember anything, write down, “No dream recalled.” This sends the message to
your inner dream maker that you would like to be in communication. It may take
a few nights, but you will get some dreams. You can also request that your
anima or animus come to you in a dream in your writing exercise before sleep.

The second method to cultivate inner union is to write letters to your
animus/anima, and respond ‘from’ them as well. This is a way to feel that your
counterpart is real, similar to inner child work. In essence, you are a
walking Trinity, with your feminine, masculine, and inner child, navigating
life. When you write to your inner Beloved, express gratitude for what they
are to you, and acknowledge all the ways they have been expressed in your
life, going back to childhood. When you write back to yourself from them, say
all the things you wish to hear from a lover: “All that matters to me is your
bliss. I’m committed to doing whatever it takes for you to experience love and
abundance …” This is a way to withdraw the projection of your anima/animus on
your 42

ex. That is what you yearn for. You long for the integration of that energy
that you asked the romantic partner to carry for you. You needed the
projection for a time, because you needed your internal Beloved to be
projected outwards, to be visible to you. For instance, maybe you were with
someone who is artistic, but this is an aspect of yourself in which you feel
insecure. Your partner’s embodiment of this quality is showing you a hidden
aspect of your own anima/animus. By writing letters to your anima/animus, you
invite that aspect to integrate back into yourself. The letter writing doesn’t
always feel like immediate relief, but it is a way to draw the internal lover
out of the shadow and into conscious awareness. And it can be deeply healing
and soothing for loneliness.

43

![Image 5](index-44_1.jpg)

The third method regarding inner union, is to develop in the areas associated
with that corresponding energy.

This is sometimes challenging and takes commitment over a lifetime, because it
involves undoing a lot of programming, but I promise it will get you out of
the dark night heartbreak. For many feminines, this means pursuing
professional and creative pursuits, as well as money manifestation. There can
be resistance to this for feminines who are highly-attuned to relationships
over 44

these areas. We have often been sold a deception that offers partnership as a
salve to trauma. So, it often naturally follows that suffering is conceived as
ameliorated only via partnership. But that’s not true.

And divine feminines on a spiritual path are sometimes kept out of partnership
by the universe so that they can come into inner union first. She must come
into authentic relationship with her purpose. For masculines, the work of
embodying the anima often centers on emotions, intuition, and even psychic
abilities. The divine masculine must connect with his inner oracle. If he does
not, he suffers a painful sense of emptiness and lack of fulfillment, and may
blindly seek his anima in empty sexual encounters, addictions, or over-
working. Each needs to funnel their energy into the ‘inferior function,’

meaning the aspect in which they feel less competency.

This entails confronting fear, taking risks, and surrendering the ego.

I would say that this method- the development of the qualities of the “Other”
requires the most self-discipline, because it goes against the grain of
habits. Self-discipline is built moment-by-moment. For the divine feminine,
that could mean consistently pivoting away from 45

romantic preoccupation and pouring energy into creative pursuits, money
management, and manifestation. For the divine masculine, self-discipline may
mean courageously meeting himself in his heart center and accepting and
transmuting the raw emotion there, over and over again.

This process, of intimacy with the internal “Beloved” is a profound and sacred
experience of divine love, from the inside out. The Beloved is the home for
which you were always nostalgic, though it is a place you cannot quite
remember having lived. Application of these tools helps you row across the
abyss and prepares your heart to hold the frequency of love. As love shows up
in human form, you will receive it so easily you will wonder why you ever
thought love had to be earned.


## **The Future**

What happens over time with this kind of work is an inner solidarity and calm
confidence about navigating _all_ aspects of life, not just the parts that are
comfortable.

There is an overflowing of creative ideas and intuition, and an ability to
seed these thoughts into the future 46

with precision. Unclaimed energy and gifts from the unconscious are no longer
siphoning precious resources.

Instead, inner alignment clicks into place, creating a powerful inner magnet
for receiving. Manifestation becomes less about effort, and more about
attunement.

The previous romantic attachment carries less charge, and the dynamic may even
become a bit boring to you.

The part of you that invested it with meaning, purpose, and a feeling of
worthiness, has grown into spiritual sovereignty. The inner child is still
there, but is no longer driving you towards toxic connections and trauma
reenactments.

With inner union, you get to experience a rebirth, as your balanced feminine
and masculine nourish your inner world. You will enjoy the pleasures of this
world anew, uninhibited by unprocessed trauma. This clarity begins in your
body. Your energy becomes so loving and attractive, that the good can’t help
but move towards you. And because your tears have created a fertile soil
within the depths of your beautiful heart, the good will flourish in you and
the lives you touch. This will be an experience of resplendent grace the
caliber of which vastly exceeds any addictive bump you ever garnered 47

from substances, relationships, or daydreaming. You can’t imagine it when you
are in the dark night of the soul, which is what makes your forward motion an
act of defiant faith. Your trust in taking steps forward without perceiving
the path before you, is how you raise your hand for joy. Approach this with
the wonder and curiosity of a child.

You have the profound privilege of deciding that pain, fear, and confusion are
acceptable mysteries here at Earth school. That is power. From that place of
equanimity, you will create from your authentic soul. It will probably not
look like what the ego would have wanted before the dark night of the soul.
But you will understand so deeply that unconsciousness, delusion, fantasy, and
addictions to the programming are suffering, and those past desires elicit
only your soft compassion now. You will be excited about where Spirit wants to
take you next, without dread of what you will need to sacrifice in the
process, because with each cycle of shedding you glow brighter and brighter.
